definition: to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: Three sisters grow up on a chicken farm in a small town of Gifu.
sentences.chinese: 澤田家在岐阜縣經營養雞場，家裏有三個姐妹花。
博吉斯是養雞場的場主。

sentences.english: Were all the capons disposed of when the bird flu spread?
sentences.chinese: 禽流感的時候養雞場的閹雞都處理了嗎？

sentences.english: Officials say the outbreak was discovered on a poultry farm in pichit province.
sentences.chinese: 有關官員說，皮奇特省的一個養雞場爆發了禽流感。

sentences.english: They landed up the pond to build a chicken farm.
sentences.chinese: 他們把池塘填沒，建一個養雞場。

sentences.english: The father chicken farm next to a tree osmanthus trees, thick with leaves and deep-rooted.
sentences.chinese: 父親養雞場旁有一棵桂花樹，根深葉茂。

sentences.english: Many chickens lay eggs on this chicken farm.
sentences.chinese: 這個養雞場每天都有很多雞下蛋。

definition: on call/always available/ready at all times
black-boned chicken/silky fowl/silkie/Gallus gallus domesticus Brisson/see also 烏骨雞|乌骨鸡[wu1 gu3 ji1]
dioxin, carcinogenic heterocyclic hydrocarbon (esp. Taiwan usage)
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
